00049 #ifndef H_EnumeratedDomain 
00050 # define H_EnumeratedDomain
00051 
00052 # include <algorithm>
00053 # include <iterator>
00054 # include <set>
00055 
00056 # include "BasicEnumerated.hh"
00057 
00058 namespace TREX {
00059   namespace transaction {
00060     
00092     template< typename Ty, class Comp=std::less<Ty> >
00093     class EnumeratedDomain :public BasicEnumerated {
00094     private:
00096       typedef std::set<Ty, Comp> container_type;
00097       
00098     public:
00100       typedef typename container_type::const_iterator iterator;
00101       
00108       explicit EnumeratedDomain(TREX::utils::Symbol const &type)
00109       :BasicEnumerated(type) {}
00124       template<class Iter>
00125       EnumeratedDomain(TREX::utils::Symbol const &type,
00126                        Iter from, Iter to)
00127       :BasicEnumerated(type), m_elements(from, to) {
00128         if( m_elements.empty() )
00129           throw EmptyDomain(*this, "Newly created EnumeratedDomain is empty.");
00130       }
00131       
00139       explicit EnumeratedDomain(TREX::utils::Symbol const &type,
00140                                 Ty const &val)
00141       :BasicEnumerated(type) {
00142         add(val);
00143       }
00144       
00146       virtual ~EnumeratedDomain() {}
00147       
00148       // Extra helpers
00164       void add(Ty const &val) {
00165         m_elements.insert(val);
00166       }
00187       template<class Iter>
00188       void add(Iter from, Iter to) {
00189         m_elements.insert(from, to);
00190       }
00191       
00197       bool contains(Ty const &val) const {
00198         return isFull() || end()!=m_elements.find(val);
00199       }
00200       bool intersect(DomainBase const &other) const;
00201       bool equals(DomainBase const &other) const;
00202       DomainBase &restrictWith(DomainBase const &other);
00203       
00204       size_t getSize() const {
00205         return m_elements.size();
00206       }
00207       
00208       boost::any getElement(size_t i) const {
00209         typename container_type::const_iterator it = begin();
00210         // std::set doe not provide operator[]
00211         // I need to do the iteration by my own
00212         for(; i>0 && end()!=it; ++it, --i);
00213         // if it==end() the behavior is undefined
00214         // but that also means that i>=getSize()
00215         return *it;
00216       }
00224       iterator begin() const {
00225         return m_elements.begin();
00226       }
00234       iterator end() const {
00235         return m_elements.end();
00236       }
00237       
00238     protected:
00245       EnumeratedDomain(EnumeratedDomain const &other)
00246       :BasicEnumerated(other), m_elements(other.m_elements) {}
00268       EnumeratedDomain(boost::property_tree::ptree::value_type &node) 
00269       :BasicEnumerated(node) {
00270         completeParsing(node);
00271       }
00272       
00273       void addTextValue(std::string const &val) {
00274         add(TREX::utils::string_cast<Ty>(val));
00275       }
00276       std::ostream &print_value(std::ostream &out, size_t i) const {
00277         // Not very optimal but this is the easiest way to go
00278         return out<<(getTypedElement<Ty, false>(i));
00279       }
00280       
00281     private:
00291       container_type m_elements;
00292       
00293     }; // EnumeratedDomain<>
00294     
00295     /*
00296      * class EnumeratedDomain<>
00297      */
00298     
00299     template<class Ty, class Cmp>
00300     bool EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp>::intersect(DomainBase const &other) const {
00301       if( getTypeName()!=other.getTypeName() ) 
00302         return false;
00303       else {
00304         EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &ref 
00305         = dynamic_cast<EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &>(other);
00306         if( isFull() || ref.isFull() )
00307           return true;
00308         else {
00309           iterator i = begin(), j = ref.begin();
00310           iterator const endi = end();
00311           iterator const endj = ref.end();
00312           
00313           while( endi!=i && endj!=j ) {
00314             if( m_elements.key_comp()(*i, *j) )
00315               ++i;
00316             else if( m_elements.key_comp()(*j, *i) )
00317               ++j;
00318             else 
00319               // *i and *j are equals -> intersection is not empty
00320               return true;
00321           }
00322           // no similar items -> itersection is empty
00323           return false;
00324         }
00325       }
00326     }
00327     
00328     template<class Ty, class Cmp>
00329     bool EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp>::equals(DomainBase const &other) const {
00330       if( getTypeName()!=other.getTypeName() ) 
00331         return false;
00332       else {
00333         EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &ref 
00334         = dynamic_cast<EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &>(other);
00335         return m_elements==ref.m_elements;
00336       }
00337     }
00338     
00339     template<class Ty, class Cmp>
00340     DomainBase &EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp>::restrictWith(DomainBase const &other) {
00341       if( getTypeName()!=other.getTypeName() ) 
00342         throw EmptyDomain(*this, "Incompatible types");
00343       else {
00344         EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &ref 
00345         = dynamic_cast<EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &>(other);    
00346         container_type tmp;
00347         std::set_intersection(begin(), end(), ref.begin(), ref.end(), 
00348                               std::inserter(tmp, tmp.begin()), 
00349                               m_elements.key_comp());
00350         if( tmp.empty() ) 
00351           throw EmptyDomain(*this, "intersection is empty.");
00352         m_elements.swap(tmp);
00353       }
00354       return *this;
00355     }
00356     
00357     
00358   } // TREX::transaction
00359 } // TREX
